General Topics
Information
Loading views

NOTE: When loading module views, you must specify the module that contains the view file.

// Default MVC View
$this->load->view('View_File',$data);
// Module View
$this->load->view('Your_Module/View_File',$data);
Loading a module
$this->load->module('Your_Module/Your_Method',$param);
Loading View Partials
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <title>Main View File</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <!-- Content -->

    // Loading a view partial with default MVC
    $this->load->view('view_file',$data);
    // Loading a view partial using a module (using HMVC)
    $this->load->module('Test_module/test_view',$data);

    <!-- End Content -->
    <footer>
      &copy; 2019
    </footer>
  </body>
</html>

Default MVC is simpler when loading view partials because you're basically just loading view files inside of other view files. However, with Modules you're calling a module method to load a view file, for example:

class Test_module extends KISS_Controller
{
  public function __construct()
  {
    parent::__construct();
  }

  public function test_view($data)
  {
    $this->load->view('test_module/test_view',$data);
  }

}
Models

Models are classes used to communicate with a database to relay data a controller can utilize.

Loading models

NOTE: You must specify the _model suffix after the name of the model. And when loading a module model you must also specify the name of the module that contains the model file.

// Default MVC Model
$this->load->model('Your_model');
// Module Model
$this->load->model('Your_Module/Your_model');
Error Handling

Show_error works very similar to CodeIgniter's version, however, the parameters are a bit different.

show_error()

show_error( $heading, $message='Your custom error message', $error_code);

Show_404 works similar to CodeIgniter's version, except it has added support for modules. You can also set a custom error message by passing in an array in to the first paramater. The second parameter is optional, where you can specify a module for errors to work correctly within modules.

show_404()

show_404( $msg = array(), $module = array() );
Examples
show_404('',['Demo_module']); // Display 404 message for module
show_404(array('heading'=>'','message'=>''), ['Demo_module']); // Display custom 404 message for module
show_404(); // Display default 404 message
show_404(array('heading'=>'','message'=>'')); // Display custom default 404 message
Loading libraries
Database Library

This method works similar to CodeIgniter's version except you have the ability to pass in an optional array containing your database configuration. The first parameter specifies the library and the second is for your database. This allows you to connect to two databases simultaneously.

$this->load->library(array('database'),array(
   'db_host'=>'localhost',
   'db_user'=>'root',
   'db_pass'=>'',
   'db_name'=>'Your_Database_Name',
 ));

Once loaded you could do something like this:

$query = $this->database->query('YOUR_QUERY');
